content.title: Junior Research Fellowship In Engineering & Technology
content.beneficiary: Candidates pursuing Ph.D. in Engineering and Technology
content.details: The scheme 'Junior Research Fellowship in Engineering & Technology' by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education is meant for candidates who wish to pursue research leading to a Ph.D. degree in engineering and technology. There are 50 slots under this scheme per year.
benefits: Fellowship @ Rs. 14,000/- p.m. for the initial two years, @ Rs.15,000/- for the remaining period
Contingency @ Rs.12,000/- p.a. for the initial two years, @Rs.25,000/- p.a. for the remaining period
Departmental Assistance @ Rs. 3,000/- p.a. per student to the host institute
Escorts/Reader Assistance @Rs.2,000/- p.m. for physically handicapped and blind candidates
HRA as per the rule of the concerned institution
eligibility: Minimum qualifications are a master's degree in engineering/technology/pharmacy, with 55 percent marks
GATE is not a mandatory condition for getting a research fellowship to pursue Ph.D.
Candidates need to hold an M.E./M.Tech. degree
The age limit is 40 years as on 1 July of the year of the award, extendable by five years for women and SC/ST candidates
22.5 percent of the fellowships are reserved for candidates belonging to SC/ST who fulfill the requisite qualifications
exclusions: Failure in any of the examinations related to Ph.D.
documents_required: Proof of DOB (Birth Certificate or Class 10th Marksheet)
Proof of educational qualifications (mark sheets, certificates, diplomas, etc.)
Certificate from the head of the department/institution
A brief abstract not exceeding 500 words on the proposed research work
Proof regarding Employment Status (if currently employed)
ID proof provided by the government

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide an opportunity to research scholars to undertake advanced study and research in engineering and technology, and agricultural engineering, leading to Ph.D.

faqs.question: Is There A Validity To The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The benefits are provided till the complete duration of the course.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Fellowship Provided In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Fellowship @ Rs. 14,000/- p.m. for the initial two years, @ Rs.15,000/- for the remaining period.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Contingency Provided In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Contingency @ Rs.12,000/- p.a. for the initial two years, @Rs.25,000/- p.a. for the remaining period.

faqs.question: Is Medical Assistance Provided To The Candidate?
faqs.answer: No separate/fixed medical assistance is provided. However, the fellow may avail the medical facilities available in the institution/university.

faqs.question: How Many Days Of Leave In A Year Are The Researchers Entitled To?
faqs.answer: Research Fellows are entitled to a maximum period of 30 days leave in a year in addition to public holidays.

faqs.question: Is Maternity Leave Provided To Women Candidates?
faqs.answer: Women candidates are eligible for maternity leave of 135 days at full rates of fellowship once during the tenure of their award.
